body:
You can try something like this:

let intervalId = setInterval(() => {
   this.updateData();
}, 15000);

updateData(){
  this._mySub = this._myService.getSomething()
                          .subscribe(
                              response => this._listOfSomething = response,
                              error => this._loggerService.log(2, "warn",   "Error bla bla")
                          );
}

Good practice is to clear interval when is no needed. You should place your interval in ngOnInit() and clear it in ngOnDestroy(). Because if you will put it in constructor it will keep updating even when you will switch components (go to another subpage on website).

EDIT. You can clear interval using clearInterval(intervalId).
title: Angular 2: Running HTTP call on interval
